info.title: SuperOffice Agent API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

post.summary: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range.
post.description:
The appointments belong to the project specified. If the logged on user is not allowed to view this projects appointments an exception is thrown.
NsApiSlow threshold: 2000 ms.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: ProjectId, StartTime, EndTime, Count

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

post.summary: Adds a sales lead (task) to a contact in SuperOffice.
post.description:
If the contact or person is known, the sales lead is added to the current contact. If not, a new contact is created, with the associate with ownerIdForNewContact as responsible (Our Contact). A relation is created between the contact and the person submitting the lead. Based on wether the person the request is made for is found or not, the following happens: If the person is found, the person, person's contact and sales representative is returned. If neither the person nor the contact is found a new person and contact is created (if sufficient data is supplied), and the person, person's contact and sales representative is returned. If the contact and not the person is found a new person is created on this contact, and the contact, salesrep, and person is returned (if there was enough data to return the person). If more than one contact is found a list of contacts is returned.
NsApiSlow threshold: 2000 ms.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: AssociateIdForNewContact, LeadDescription, Relation, RelationId, LeadContact, LeadPersonFirstname, LeadPersonLastname, LeadPersonEmail, LeadPhoneNumber, CreatorsContact, CreatorsFirstname, CreatorsLastname

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Appointme.description: GetProjectAppointments: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range. The appointments belong to the project specified. If the logged on user is not allowed to view this projects appointments an exception is thrown.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Appointment.description:
Simple read-only appointment data.
<para />
Carrier object for Appointment.
Services for the Appointment Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IAppointmentAgent">Appointment Agent</see>.

Type.description: The different types of appointment, if the appointment is supposed to be shown in the diary or checklist, or if it's a document. See the different types of appointments in the database manual.

Task.description: Task comprises the different types of activities, like “Phone call”, “Meeting” and so on.

AssociateFullName.description: The owner of the appointment - the associate whose diary/checklist the appointment is in.

ContactName.description: The contact associated with the appointment.

Description.description: The appointment's textbox; holds a descriptive text about the appointment. Filled out by the user.

PersonFullName.description: The full name of the person this appointment belongs to.

PersonId.description: Person ID of person the appointment is with, may be 0

ContactId.description: Contact ID of owning contact, may be 0

ProjectId.description: ID of project referred to, may be 0

ProjectName.description: The name of the project this appointment belong to. Blank if no project is connected.

IsPublished.description: True if appointment have an entry in published table

AssociateId.description: ID of associate whose diary the appointment is in, REQUIRED

ColorIndex.description: Appointment colour, used only in Japanese versions. Western versions take colour from Task

IsFree.description: True if free, false if busy

HasAlarm.description: Does this appointment have an alarm

Private.description: Obsolete, but still maintained field for appointment privacy; denormalization of visiblefor status

TaskType.description: The different task types of the appointment, if the activity is an appointment, task, phone. See the different types of appointments in the database manual.

IsBookingMain.description: True if this appointment is a booking and current associate is the owner. False if it is a booking and current associate is a participant.

IsRecurrence.description: True if the appointment is part of a recurring pattern.

IsBooking.description: True if this appointment is a booking.

ActiveDate.description: The date to be used for searching & showing

AssignmentStatus.description: Status if this appointment is in the process of being assigned to someone else

InvitationStatus.description: Status if this appointment represents an invitation

BookingType.description: The type of booking the appointment represents

MotherId.description: ID of mother appointment; self if booking master, master ID if booking slave, 0 if normal appointment. However, if 0 and assoc_id != reg_id then this is an assigned appointment, indicated vt type = kBooking

AssignedBy.description: Who (last) assigned this appointment to associate_id?

AssignedByFullName.description: The associate's culture formatted fullname (firstname, middleName and lastname)

RejectReason.description: Why was this booking or assignment rejected, the RejectReason list is a source of suggestions but you can write anything here

Location.description: Location for appointment, defaulted from invited resource of type place and other rules, but you can write anything you want here

SaleName.description: Heading of Owning sale, if any. (may be blank)

CreatedBy.description: Who created the appointment. Associate name.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Appointme.description: GenerateLead: Adds a sales lead (task) to a contact in SuperOffice. If the contact or person is known, the sales lead is added to the current contact. If not, a new contact is created, with the associate with ownerIdForNewContact as responsible (Our Contact). A relation is created between the contact and the person submitting the lead. Based on wether the person the request is made for is found or not, the following happens: If the person is found, the person, person's contact and sales representative is returned. If neither the person nor the contact is found a new person and contact is created (if sufficient data is supplied), and the person, person's contact and sales representative is returned. If the contact and not the person is found a new person is created on this contact, and the contact, salesrep, and person is returned (if there was enough data to return the person). If more than one contact is found a list of contacts is returned.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Appointme.description: ToggleAppointmentStatus: Sets an appointment's status to Completed if the appointment had a different status, or sets the status to started if already set to completed.
ToggleActivity: Toggle the completed status for an activity. Activity may be sale, document or appointment. The changes are saved immediately.
ToggleActivities: Toggle the completed status for an array of activities.

SetActivityStatus: Sets the completed status for an array of activities. The string activityIdentifier param may contain of a mix of appointment_id, sale_id, document_id and todo_id. The changes are saved immediately. If an invalid id is passed in (nonexistent record), no changes will be made. If there is no write access to the record being changed, a Sentry exception will be thrown in the usual manner.

ToggleAndSetActivities: Toggles the first activity and sets the rest of the activities to the result of the first toggle. However, there are some special rules for appointments that trigger a suggested appointment when they are completed. If more than one appointment in the set of identifiers triggers a suggestion, we will not toggle those appointments. This rule is only active when changing the status of an appointment to complete. There must be more than one appointment that triggers such an event for this rule to take effect.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.AppointmentEnti.description: Partial AppointmentEntity class associating the generated AppointmentEntity with an interface.

Associate.description:
The owner of the appointment - the associate whose diary/checklist the appointment is in. 
<para>Use MDO List name "associate" to get list items.</para>

Contact.description:
The contact associated with the appointment. It may also be null if no contact is associated with the appointment. 
<para>Use MDO List name "contact_new" to get list items.</para>

CreatedBy.description: The associate that first created the appointment. The property is read-only.

UpdatedBy.description: The person that last updated the appointment.

InvitedPerson.description: If the appointment is a booking, the invited persons may be your associates, but you are also able to invite contact persons from other companies to join your meeting. They do not receive an invitation, unless you send them one by email, but you can see in the appointment that persons other than your associates have been invited to a meeting. Each invited person will have an appointment slave record.

Person.description:
An appointment may also be connected to a person; this must be a contact person registered on the current company. This does not mean however that a person is required. 
<para>Use MDO List name "person" to get list items.</para>

MotherId.description: ID of mother appointment; self if booking master, master ID if booking slave, 0 if normal appointment. However, if 0 and assoc_id != reg_id then this is an assigned appointment, indicated vt type = kBooking

Priority.description:
It's possible to give appointments different priorities. All the different priority types are saved in the priority table, and edited from the Admin. Client. An appointment does not require a priority. 
<para>Use MDO List name "priority" to get list items.</para>

Private.description: The confidentiality of appointments is shown as different types of “private” on the appointment. For an updated list of “private” types, see the database manual.

Project.description:
An appointment may also be connected to a project, so you see the appointment both on the company card, and on the project card. This does not mean however that a project is required. 
<para>Use MDO List name "project" to get list items.</para>

Type.description: The different types of appointment, if the appointment is supposed to be shown in the diary or checklist, or if it's a document. See the different types of appointments in the database manual.

Completed.description: Appointment Completed state. This property is the part of the Status property that is the completed state. Could be three state if the three state user preference is set.

ActiveLinks.description: Number of active links to sale, document, appointment.

Links.description: List of all elements linked to the appointment.

HasAlarm.description: Does this appointment have an alarm

ColorIndex.description: Appointment colour, used only in Japanese versions. Western versions take colour from Task

IsFree.description: True if free, false if busy

LagTime.description: as leadtime, but after the end - time blocked for travel etc.

Location.description: Location for appointment, defaulted from invited resource of type place and other rules, but you can write anything you want here

RejectCounter.description: How many invitees have rejected this appointment

RejectReason.description:
Why was this booking or assignment rejected, the RejectReason list is a source of suggestions but you can write anything here 
<para>Use MDO List name "rejectReason" to get list items.</para>

Participants.description: List of id's of the participants to this appointment.

AssignmentStatus.description: Status if this appointment is in the process of being assigned to someone else

InvitationStatus.description: Status if this appointment represents an invitation

BookingType.description: The type of booking the appointment represents

ActiveDate.description: The date to be used for searching & showing

HasConflict.description: Does the appointment overlap with another appointment in the user's diary?

AssignedBy.description: Who assigned this appointment to this user? Whose diary did the appointment come from?

MotherAssociate.description: The owner of the mother appointment - the associate whose diary/checklist the mother appointment is in.  The mother appointment is the one identified by the mother_id. If the mother_id is 0 or the same as this appointment_id, then the master associate will be the same as the 'ordinary' associate.

Task.description:
Task comprises the different types of activities, like “Phone call”, “Meeting” and so on. 
<para>Use MDO List name "task" to get list items.</para>

Sale.description:
An appointment may also be connected to a sale, so you see the appointment on the company card, on the project card and on the sale card. This does not mean however that a sale is required. 
<para>Use MDO List name "sale" to get list items.</para>

SuggestedAppointmentId.description: Suggested guide item that this appointment is an instance of (Note: NOT VALID for document-type appointments, they have their own link)

CautionWarning.description: Status field to indicate appointments that have some sort of problem

OwnedExternally.description: Set if an external system owns this appointment.

JoinVideomeetUrl.description: Blank when not a video meeting. Filled with Join Meeting URL when created.

CentralserviceVideomeetId.description: GUID for video meeting in central services – this is set when we create meetings from SuperOffice. It is blank for incoming meetings created from inbox.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Appointme.description: CreateDefaultAppointmentEntityByType: Creates an AppointmentEntity populated with the default values for the specific type.

CreateAppointmentEntityFromExisting: Creates an AppointmentEntity populated with values from an existing appointment. The new appointment will get the same task type and participant list as the source appointment. The date of the new appointment will be set to today, but the time component is kept.
Accept: Accepting an appointment invitation.
CreateAndAccept: Creating an appointment from an emailItem invitation and accepting it.
AcceptWithEmailConfirmation: Accepting an appointment invitation and send an email confirmation to the meeting organizer.
CreateAndAcceptWithEmailConfirmation: Creating an appointment from an emailItem invitation and accepting it with email confirmation to the meeting organizer.
Reject: Rejecting an appointment invitation
RejectWithEmailConfirmation: Rejecting an appointment invitation and send an email confirmation to the meeting organizer.
DeclineInvitationFromEmailItem: Declining an appointment invitation where no tentative appointments have been created.
GetOrganizerName: Lookup the name / email of an event-organizer
Save: Saving a booking.
Delete: Deleting a booking
CalculateDays: Calculates the set of dates that represents a recurrence pattern. Adds conflict information to each date.
ValidateDays: Validates the set of dates to calculate any conflicts.
AssignTo: Assigning an appointment to another person.
SetSeen: Sets an appointment invitiation to seen.
SetSeenMany: Sets a list of appointment invitations to seen. The same update mode will be used for all appointments in this batch.
Move: Moving a booking to another start time.
MoveWithEmail: Moving a booking to another start time.
MoveExtended: Moving a booking to another start time and with new info and possibly notifications.

UpdateMode.description: Update mode for a recurring appointment.

SendEmailToParticipants.description: If true, emails will be sent to all participants that is marked with send email flag if deemed necessary. If false no mails will be sent even if the send email flag is true.

SmtpEMailConnectionInfo.description: Login information for outgoing smtp email server. Will be null if no login information is relevant.

ImapEMailConnectionInfo.description: Login information for imap server. Will be null if no login information is relevant.

IsAlldayEvent.description: If true, the appointment should be set to all day

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Appointme.description: AcceptRejected: Accept that an invited participant has rejected your invitation or assignment.
CreateDefaultRecurrenceByDate: Creates a RecurrenceInfo object populated with the default values for the specific type. Using startDate as start date for the recurreing pattern.
CleanUpBookingDeleted: Deletes all appointments(within the appointmentIds array) with status BookingDeleted.

CleanUpBookingDeletedWithUpdateMode: Deletes all appointments(within the appointmentIds array) with status BookingDeleted. All appointments in the list will be deleted using the same recurrence update mode.
CreateDefaultAppointmentEntityByTypeAndAssociate: Creates a AppointmentEntity populated with the default values for the specific type and owner.
GetCanInsertForAssociates: Check if current associate can create appointments in the diary of other associates.

GetAppointmentHaveParticipantsWithEmail: GetAppointmentHaveParticipantsWithEmail will check if any of the participants is marked to receive emails on this appointment. If no participants are defined, false will be returned.
CreateDefaultAppointmentEntityFromSaleSuggestion: Creates an appointment based on a suggested appointment.
GetNextSuggestedAppointmentBySale: Gets the next suggested appointment for a given sale (or rather a given sale's guide).
CreateDefaultReOpenAppointment: A re-open appointment should be created as a reminder to re-open the sale at a certain date with information regarding the stalled sale.
CreateDefaultAppointmentEntityFromProjectSuggestion:
CreateAppointmentForUID: Create an invitation record and an appointment with a given UID to reserve it if the UID is unused, otherwise null.
GetAppointmentFromUID: Get the appointment that corresponds to the given UID.
CanAssignToProjectMember:
GetUIDFromAppointmentId: Get the UID associated with the appointment id in the Invitation table.
UpdateAppointmentFromIcsResponse: Update the attendance to an appointment based on incoming ICS RSVPs.
ValidateAppointmentEntity: Check that entity is ready for saving.
WillSendEmail: Returns true if the changes will trigger email sending on Save, so you can inform the user.
AcceptWithSmtpEmailConfirmation: Accepting an appointment invitation and send an email confirmation to the meeting organizer.
RejectWithSmtpEmailConfirmation: Rejecting an appointment invitation and send an email confirmation to the meeting organizer.
GetAppointmentEmailInvitation: Create an EMailEntity (without an ical attachment) with the email sent to participants when the appointment is saved

GetMyAppointments: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range. The appointments belong to the currently logged on user.

GetPersonAppointments: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range. The appointments belong to the person specified. If the person not is a SuperOffice user (associate) or the logged on user is not allowed to view this persons appointments an exception is thrown.

GetMyDiary: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range. It only returns appointments that would be displayed in the user's diary. The appointments belong to the currently logged on user.

GetMyTasks: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range. It only returns appointments that would be displayed in the user's task list. The appointments belong to the currently logged on user.

GetPersonDiary: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range. It only returns appointments that would be displayed in the user's diary. The appointments belong to the person specified. If the person not is a SuperOffice user (associate) or the logged on user is not allowed to view this persons appointments an exception is thrown.

GetPersonTasks: Method that returns a specified number of appointments within a time range. It only returns appointments that would be displayed in the user's task list. The appointments belong to the person specified. If the person not is a SuperOffice user (associate) or the logged on user is not allowed to view this persons appointments an exception is thrown.
GetPersonAppointmentsByType: Method that returns a specified number of appointments of a specific appointment type within a time range. The appointments belong to the person specified.

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.
